title: The Mahabharata by Vyasa: the epic of ancient India condensed into English verse
creator: Romesh C Dutt
description: LibriVox recording of The Mahabharata by Vyasa: The epic of ancient India condensed into English verse by Romesh C. Dutt. Read by om123. The Mahabharata is one of the two major Sanskrit epics of ancient India. Traditionally, the authorship of the Mahabharata is attributed to Vyasa. With more than 74,000 verses, Mahabharata is said to be the longest poem. Mahabharata tells the story of the epic Kurukshetra War and the fates of the cousin brothers Kauravas and the Pandavas. But more than that the Mahabharata contains much philosophical and devotional material, such as a discussion of the four "goals of life" or 'purusharthas'. The latter are enumerated as dharma (right action), artha (purpose), kama (pleasure), and moksha (liberation). (Introduction by om123) For further information, including links to online text, reader information, RSS feeds, CD cover or other formats (if available), please go to the LibriVox catalog page for this recording. For more free audio books or to become a volunteer reader, visit LibriVox.org. Download M4B (178MB)
subject: audiobook;librivox; epic; Indian literature; Mahabharata; Vyasa; adaptation
source: Librivox recording of a public-domain text
